summary: The Keep Kids Covered Act aims to expand healthcare coverage for children under Medicaid and CHIP. Key provisions include continuous eligibility for newborns up to age 6, continuous eligibility for children ages 6-18, and continuous eligibility for former foster youth up to age 26. The bill also mandates states to update contact information for enrolled individuals and clarifies the application of existing coverage continuity for former foster children. The amendments will take effect a year after enactment.
